newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Aug 20.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Aug 20.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Tuesday morning.
NEWS OUTLOOK:
** The chief of India largest commercial bank, State Bank of India, says lending rates may be cut because of falling bank advances and rising deposits, the Economic Times reports

** India revamps tender evaluation committee that examines applications to operate basic and cellular telephone services, after federal police seizes more than $1 million in cash from two homes owned by former minister Sukh Ram
** Telecommunications officials say sweeping privatisation programme will survive allegations of corruption involving former communications minister
** Foreign funds stakes in Indian firms exceed 24 percent ceiling, due to their holdings in global depositary receipts which can be converted into underlying stocks, the Economic Times reports
** The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) government in western Gujarat state on the verge of collapse following infighting. The BJP is India's main opposition party
** India's 24-sector industrial production index rises 4.5 percent in June over the same month in 1995, the Industry Ministry says

** Kuala Lumpur-based Renong Bhd plans to sign deal with an Indian company in November to jointly build a $20 billion superhighway connecting major cities in India, Malaysian Works Minister S. Samy Vellu said on Monday
** The spot dollar/rupee INR= opened steady at 35.66/68 per dollar and seen in tight range
MARKETS:
** Indian stock markets fell sharply on Monday pulled down by foreign institutional selling and little local support
** The revamped 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index fell 101.26 points, or 2.99 percent, to 3,281.49
** The 100-share National index .NATEX dropped 42.61 points, or 2.74 percent, to 1,514.01
** The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index .NSEI ended 26.0 points lower at 976
** The 500-share CRISIL declined 18.12 points to 666.22
** The Delhi share index shed 3.06 points to 799.77
** The Calcutta index .CALSN fell 6.19 points to 439.71
** The Madras index .MDSI shed 18.53 points to 3,551.89
** The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI edged down 0.80 points, or 1.18 percent, to 66.77 with the premium over the local market at 5.36 percent compared with Friday's 3.58 percent
